alfredsnippet.snippet:
"Just because physicists in Bohr's time could not penetrate beyond the apparent randomness of radioactive decay and other microscopic processes, to find a deeper lawfulness and regularity underlying such processes, does not mean that science is doomed to remain in that state of ignorance forever!"

- Jonathan Tennenbaum
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - The Randomness of Quantum Mechanics is Not Forever
